info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 01 at 11:53AM CDT until April 05 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Illinois... Kaskaskia River at Vandalia. River forecasts are based on observed precipitation and forecast precipitation for the next 24 hours. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Kaskaskia River at Vandalia. * WHEN...Until early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 26.0 feet, The Dively and Vandalia Levees begin to be overtopped. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 AM CDT Friday the stage was 26.0 feet and rising. - Recent Activity...The river began a sharp rise Wednesday evening, first reaching flood stage at 1:30 AM on Thursday. Moderate flooding began when the river reached 24 feet at 12:30 AM Friday morning, and major flooding has now begun at 26 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest near 26.1 feet this evening. It will then begin to fall this evening, falling below flood stage Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Tue Wed Kaskaskia River Vandalia 18.0 26.0 Fri 11 am 24.5 19.2 16.1 14.6 13.8 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. This product, along with additional weather and stream information, is available at https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=lsx.
